title: Web Developer, eCRM
description:
This position is posted by Jobgether on behalf of a partner company. We are currently looking for a Web Developer, eCRM in the United States.

As a Web Developer, eCRM, you will play a pivotal role in supporting digital initiatives by building and maintaining custom web solutions that enhance user engagement, fundraising, and advocacy efforts. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, ensuring web projects meet technical, security, and compliance standards while delivering seamless user experiences. This role emphasizes both front-end development expertise and strategic problem-solving to optimize websites and forms for global audiences. You will contribute to testing, documentation, and the integration of innovative digital tools, helping the organization achieve measurable impact through technology. Remote work flexibility is offered, though collaboration across Eastern Time zones may be required.

Accountabilities

  • Collaborate with Digital Marketing, Brand, Visuals, and IS teams to gather requirements and make technical recommendations.
  • Develop, maintain, and optimize custom donation forms, advocacy pages, and web applications with attention to UX, accessibility, and page speed.
  • Ensure compliance with global regulations, GDPR, and security standards in partnership with the Information Security team.
  • Troubleshoot technical issues and work closely with vendor partners to resolve system challenges.
  • Support testing initiatives, including A/B and multivariate testing, and implement new features to improve engagement.
  • Create and maintain clear documentation, including support guides and incident reports.

Requirements

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer programming, web development, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
  • Minimum of 4 years of front-end web development experience and custom website development.
  • Proficiency with HTML5, CSS/Sass, JavaScript, GitHub, and eCRM platforms such as Engaging Networks.
  • Familiarity with AWS core services, Webpack, Node, npm, and cookie consent tools (preferably Iubenda).
  • Strong attention to detail when coding from design files (Adobe XD, Figma).
  • Knowledge of responsive web design, UX, accessibility, page speed optimization, browser compatibility, and GDPR compliance.
  • Experience with A/B testing platforms, Google Analytics, and data-informed problem-solving.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with ability to multitask in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
  • Proactive, independent, and capable of contributing effectively to a team.
  • Interest in animal protection and environmental advocacy is preferred.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary: $80,000 ‚Äì $110,000 annually.
  • Full-time, fully remote position within the United States.
  • Opportunities to work on impactful digital initiatives for global advocacy campaigns.
  • Collaborative and mission-driven work environment.
  • Professional growth through cross-functional project engagement.

title: Senior Security Engineer, Identity (Remote - US)
description:
This position is posted by Jobgether on behalf of a partner company. We are currently looking for a Senior Security Engineer, Identity in the United States.

As a Senior Security Engineer, Identity, you will play a critical role in protecting and managing the organization‚Äôs identity and access landscape. You will work closely with cross-functional and global teams to design, implement, and maintain identity governance and privileged access management solutions. This role offers the opportunity to influence secure access strategies, streamline lifecycle events, and ensure compliance across on-premises and cloud environments. You will also mentor and collaborate with colleagues, troubleshoot complex challenges, and contribute to a secure, scalable, and efficient identity management ecosystem. This position thrives in a fast-paced, technically challenging, and highly collaborative environment.

Accountabilities

  • Configure, test, and deploy Identity Governance & Administration (IGA) and Privileged Access Management (PAM) solutions in collaboration with global teams and third parties.
  • Support lifecycle events including provisioning, deprovisioning, RBAC, birthright access, and access recertifications across connected systems.
  • Assist in building, testing, and deploying SailPoint ISC and CyberArk solutions, maintaining rules, workflows, certifications, roles, and provisioning policies.
  • Conduct inventory assessments and environment scans to identify privileged accounts, enforce password rotation, and ensure compliance.
  • Integrate critical systems with IGA and PAM platforms, including data normalization, troubleshooting, and documentation of lifecycle flows.
  • Monitor system performance, support patches and upgrades, and generate custom reports and dashboards.
  • Continuously execute on the Identity roadmap, improving processes, closing risks, and enhancing automation.

Requirements

  • 4+ years of experience with SailPoint ISC, including LCE configurations, RBAC, birthright provisioning, and user access review campaigns.
  • 2+ years of experience with PAM solutions, preferably CyberArk, with knowledge of privileged account lifecycle and least-privilege enforcement.
  • Familiarity with HCM systems such as SuccessFactors or Workday and ServiceNow.
  • Experience with PowerShell scripting and troubleshooting identity/access issues across cloud and on-prem systems.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and collaboration skills to manage complex identity and access challenges.
  • Ability to work independently, manage priorities, and communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Benefits

  • Fully remote work with flexibility across U.S. time zones.
  • Competitive salary and potential performance-based bonuses.
  • Comprehensive healthcare coverage including medical, dental, and vision.
  • 401(k) retirement plan with company match.
  • Paid time off, holidays, and sick leave.
  • Opportunities for professional development, training, and certifications.
  • Supportive, inclusive, and collaborative work environment.

As a Power Systems Engineer II, you will play a critical role in designing, analyzing, and optimizing electrical power systems for a variety of projects. description:
This position is posted by Jobgether on behalf of a partner company. We are currently looking for a Head of Product Management - Generative AI in the United States.

The Head of Product Management will drive the strategy and execution of a cutting-edge Generative AI orchestration and governance platform. This role owns the end-to-end product lifecycle‚Äîfrom market discovery to scaled rollout‚Äîensuring features are secure, compliant, and enterprise-ready. You will partner closely with engineering, research, compliance, and go-to-market teams to translate research and customer insights into high-impact workflows. Success in this role requires a blend of deep technical fluency in GenAI systems, hands-on product leadership experience, and the ability to embed governance, risk, and observability into AI products that accelerate safe AI adoption. The position offers a dynamic, fully remote environment with opportunities to influence enterprise AI adoption globally.

Accountabilities

  • Lead product strategy, roadmap, and execution for Generative AI orchestration and governance features.
  • Translate research and enterprise customer insights into production-ready workflows, pipelines, and deployment tooling.
  • Embed governance-by-design principles, including auditability, risk controls, bias mitigation, and regulatory alignment (e.g., EU AI Act, NIST RMF, ISO/IEC).
  • Drive evaluation and monitoring of AI systems, including observability, model drift detection, and lifecycle management.
  • Partner with cross-functional teams (engineering, ML research, compliance, and GTM) to deliver high-quality, scalable products.
  • Collaborate with go-to-market teams to develop positioning, demos, and documentation for enterprise and developer audiences.
  • Run tight execution loops: lead squads, validate with design partners, and iterate quickly based on enterprise feedback.

Requirements

  • Proven experience in product management for AI/ML platforms, developer tools, or enterprise SaaS, with end-to-end ownership of product delivery.
  • Deep understanding of Generative AI technologies, including LLM data pipelines, RAG, embeddings, vector databases, and prompt/fine-tuning workflows.
  • Hands-on experience with orchestration frameworks such as LangChain, Kubeflow, or similar workflow automation tools.
  • Technical fluency to engage credibly with engineering, data, and compliance stakeholders (APIs, embeddings, evaluation frameworks).
  • Strong knowledge of AI governance, observability, risk mitigation, and regulatory alignment.
  • Excellent cross-functional leadership, communication, and collaboration skills.
  • Experience driving metrics beyond raw accuracy, including reliability, transparency, and safety KPIs.
  • Nice-to-have: familiarity with LangSmith, LangGraph, Ray, Feast, BentoML, DVC, Flyte, Dagster, or Prefect; experience from observability, governance, AI platform companies, or major AI labs.

Benefits

  • Fully remote, work-from-home environment with flexible working hours.
  • Paid time off and long-term incentive programs.
  • Opportunities for professional advancement and continued education support.
  • Periodic in-person offsites globally (travel permitting).
  • Collaborative, high-impact role shaping enterprise AI adoption and governance.

description:

The Director of Engineering will lead the development and optimization of a high-performance AI-native data platform, driving innovation across data ingestion, transformation, and streaming frameworks. This role combines hands-on engineering with strategic leadership, guiding a team to deliver scalable, cloud-agnostic data pipelines and seamless integration with open-source ecosystems. You will collaborate across product, architecture, and field teams to enable AI workloads at scale, while contributing to platform architecture, operational excellence, and engineering best practices. Success in this role requires both deep technical expertise and the ability to inspire and mentor a high-performing engineering team in a fast-paced, globally distributed environment.

Accountabilities

  • Lead, build, and mentor a high-performing engineering team focused on the Infinia Data Engine.

Benefits

  • Lead engineering for a cutting-edge AI-native data platform with global impact.

  • Influence and contribute to high-profile open-source projects and technical communities.
  • Professional growth in a fast-paced, innovative, and collaborative environment.
  • Competitive compensation, healthcare, and retirement benefits.
  • Access to mentorship, learning resources, and team development initiatives.

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager - Remote
description:
At PayNearMe, we‚Äôre on a mission to make paying and getting paid as simple as possible. We build innovative technology that transforms the way businesses and their customers experience payments. Our industry-leading platform, PayXM‚Ñ¢, is the first of its kind‚Äîdesigned to manage the entire payment experience from start to finish. Every click, swipe or tap is seamless, fast and secure, helping non-commerce businesses boost customer satisfaction, accelerate payments, and reduce costs.

Our single platform handles it all: cards, ACH, digital wallets such as PayPal, Venmo, Cash App Pay, Apple Pay and Google Pay, and even cash at more than 62,000 retail locations nationwide. Today, thousands of businesses across consumer lending, iGaming and online sports betting, property management, and tolling trust PayNearMe to deliver a payment experience that drives real results.

In September 2025, we raised a $50 million Series E funding round to accelerate our growth. 

We‚Äôre a team of 200+ employees across 41 states, headquartered in Silicon Valley with satellite offices in Dallas, TX and Holmdel, NJ.

Join us and be part of a team that‚Äôs shaping the future of payments‚Äîone experience at a time.

As our Senior Product Marketing Manager, your mission will be to develop a deep understanding of our buyers and our market, and help us communicate our unique value.  You‚Äôll develop and maintain the positioning and messaging that differentiate our products in the market and resonate with our target audience.  You will understand the buyer‚Äôs journey and will develop content to support and enable sales.   

What you'll own and be responsible for:

  • Develop and communicate a deep understanding of the payments industry, market trends, and evolving customer needs.

title: Risk Operations Analyst II - Remote
description:
At PayNearMe, we‚Äôre on a mission to make paying and getting paid as simple as possible. We build innovative technology that transforms the way businesses and their customers experience payments. Our industry-leading platform, PayXM‚Ñ¢, is the first of its kind‚Äîdesigned to manage the entire payment experience from start to finish. Every click, swipe or tap is seamless, fast and secure, helping non-commerce businesses boost customer satisfaction, accelerate payments, and reduce costs.

Our single platform handles it all: cards, ACH, digital wallets such as PayPal, Venmo, Cash App Pay, Apple Pay and Google Pay, and even cash at more than 62,000 retail locations nationwide. Today, thousands of businesses across consumer lending, iGaming and online sports betting, property management, and tolling trust PayNearMe to deliver a payment experience that drives real results.

In September 2025, we raised a $50 million Series E funding round to accelerate our growth. 

We‚Äôre a team of 200+ employees across 41 states, headquartered in Silicon Valley with satellite offices in Dallas, TX and Holmdel, NJ.

Join us and be part of a team that‚Äôs shaping the future of payments‚Äîone experience at a time.

We are seeking a highly experienced and driven professional to join our team as a Risk Operations Analyst II. This role is pivotal in monitoring and analyzing transactions for fraudulent activity, while also collaborating with clients to align with their desired risk appetite. The ideal candidate will utilize advanced tools, data sources, and industry best practices to deliver risk services that minimize fraud losses and maximize approval rates. We are looking for an individual with robust analytical expertise, excellent client-facing communication skills, and a strong background in risk management within the payments or financial services sectors.

Key Responsibilities

Fraud & Risk Management

  • Fraud Analysis & Research: Employ advanced tools and techniques (e.g., standard and advanced rules-based risk engines, using third-party platforms like Accertify) to detect and assess fraudulent behavior and provide actionable insights.
  • Client Risk Services: Provide advanced risk services, including support for RFIs (Networks, Partners, Banks), limits adjustments, merchant underwriting, and tailored risk interventions.
  • PNM & Client Risk Events: Proactively support and resolve client and platform risk events, ensuring timely and accurate response, root cause analysis, and recommended control enhancements
  • Transaction Monitoring: Continuously monitor and analyze client, user, and transaction data to detect and investigate suspicious activity.

Client Partnership & Risk Appetite Consulting

  • Client Communication: Engage with clients to clearly explain fraud findings, risk exposures, and industry developments in a consultative manner.
  • Risk Appetite Consultation: Guide clients in defining and maintaining appropriate risk appetite strategies, balancing loss and approval rates to achieve business goals.
  • Actionable Recommendations: Offer customized guidance on fraud prevention, compliance, and operational efficiency.

Reporting & Transparency

  • BI & Custom Reporting: Generate, analyze, and deliver BI reports (using tools such as Looker, Dataiku, SQL, and Excel/Google Suite) to highlight fraud trends and ensure transparency in client and platform risk performance.
  • Internal & Client Reporting: Develop custom reporting solutions to support both internal decision-making and client requirements.
  • Policy & Process Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of policies, procedures, and standard operating processes for transparency and repeatability.

Continuous Improvement

  • Process & Product Improvement: Identify opportunities for enhanced efficiency in risk management operations, client interactions, and fraud prevention tools.
  • Vendor Risk Management: Evaluate and leverage third-party data sources and vendors to enhance fraud detection capabilities.
  • Compliance & Security: Ensure adherence to compliance, PCI, and regulatory requirements across client and platform activities.
  • 5‚Äì10 years of experience in risk management, with a focus on fraud prevention, merchant risk, and operational efficiency.
  • 3‚Äì5 years of experience in the payments industry (acquiring, issuing, or merchant risk functions).
  • Technical & Analytical Skills:
  • Proficiency in BI reporting, SQL, Looker, Dataiku, and standard productivity tools (Excel, Google Suite).
  • Strong analytical and reasoning skills, with the ability to interpret complex datasets and provide actionable insights.
  • Moderate technical ability combined with high analytical acumen.
  • Client & Risk Expertise:
  • Proven ability to manage client relationships and ensure satisfaction in high-risk merchant segments.
  • Familiarity with card network rules, compliance requirements, and fraud risk strategies.
  • Experience in policy/process documentation and product/process improvements.

Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Finance, Business, Data Analytics, Risk Management, or a related field.

Soft Skills:

  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
  • Strong collaborative mindset with the ability to operate independently.

Preferably located in the East Coast time zone.

Why Join Us?:

  • Competitive salary and benefits with growth-company options grant
  • Fast- paced and professional work culture
  • Stock options with standard startup vesting - 1 year cliff; 4 years total
  • $50 monthly communication expense stipend to go towards your phone/internet bill
  • $250 stipend to enhance your WFH setup
  • Reimbursement for peripheral equipment: monitor (up to $400), keyboard and mouse (up to $200)
  • Premium medical benefits including vision and dental (100% coverage for employees)
  • Company-sponsored life and disability insurance
  • Paid parental bonding leave
  • Paid sick leave, jury duty, bereavement
  • 401k plan
  • Flexible Time Off (our team members typically take off ~3-4 weeks per year)
  • Volunteer Time Off
  • 13 scheduled holidays

Salary Range: $105,000 - 120,000

We‚Äôre in this together to do the right thing. We deliver real results we are proud of while remaining respectful, transparent, and flexible.

CALIFORNIA CONSUMER PRIVACY ACT: APPLICANT NOTICE

Effective Date: January 1, 2020

Last Reviewed on: December 23, 2019

PayNearMe, Inc. (the ‚ÄúCompany‚Äù) is providing you with this Notice (‚ÄúNotice‚Äù) to inform you about:

  1. the categories of Personal Information that the Company collects and maintains about applicants; and
  2. the purposes for which the Company uses that Personal Information.

For purposes of this Notice, ‚ÄúPersonal Information‚Äù means information that identifies, relates to, describes, is capable of being associated with, or could reasonably be linked, directly or indirectly with, a natural person that the Company may collect in connection with screening applicants for job openings at the Company.

  1. Identifiers and Professional or Employment-Related Information. The Company collects identifiers and professional or employment-related information, which may include some or all the following: real name, nickname or alias, postal address, telephone number, e-mail address, membership in professional organizations, professional certifications, language skills, and current and past employment history. The Company collects this Personal Information to evaluate previous job performance and consider applicants for positions, to develop a talent pool and plan for succession, to conduct applicant surveys, to maintain an internal applicant directory and for purposes of identification, to promote the Company as a place to work, and for workforce reporting and data analytics/trend analysis.
  2. Personal Information Categories from Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1798.80(e). The Company may collect categories of Personal Information listed in Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß1798.80(e), other than those already listed above, (a) to the extent necessary to comply with the Company‚Äôs legal obligations, such as to accommodate disabilities; (b) to conduct a direct threat analysis in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act and state law; (c) for occupational health and safety compliance and record-keeping; and (d) to respond to an applicant‚Äôs medical emergency.
  3. Characteristics of Protected Classifications Under California or Federal Law. The Company may collect information about race, age, national origin, disability, sex, and veteran status as necessary to comply with legal obligations, including the reporting requirements of the federal Equal Employment Opportunity Act, the federal Office of Contracting Compliance Programs (applicable to government contractors), and California‚Äôs Fair Employment and Housing Act. The Company collects this Personal Information for purposes including: to comply with Federal and California law related to accommodation. The Company also collects this category of Personal Information on a purely voluntary basis, except where required by law, and uses the information only in compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
  4. Education Information. The Company collects education information such as resumes and graduation records. The Company collects this Personal Information to determine suitability for roles, to determine eligibility for training courses, and to assist with professional licensing.
  5. Profile Data. The Company may collect profile data, including the following: psychological assessments, behavior analyses, or other profiling of its applicants. The Company collects this Personal Information to determine aptitude for certain positions and job assignments as well.
  6. Background Screening Information. In the event that an applicant is given a formal job offer, the Company collects background screening information prior to hiring, including results of the following types of background screening: criminal history; sex offender registration; motor vehicle records; credit history; employment history; drug testing; and educational history. The Company collects this Personal Information to screen for risks to the Company and its clients, and continued suitability for their jobs and to evaluate applicants for promotions.

Assistance for Disabled Applicants

Alternative formats of this Notice are available to individuals with a disability. Please let us know if you need assistance.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

  • Ensure Global Compliance: Maintain and enforce policies that align with employment laws and regulatory requirements across multiple jurisdictions.
  • Drive Operational Excellence: Partner closely with People Operations, Legal, and Finance to streamline workflows, reduce time to hire, and improve hiring metrics.
  • Be a Cultural Sounding Board: Act as a trusted thought partner to the VP, People and broader leadership team, proactively identifying gaps and pushing back thoughtfully when needed.

  • Seamless and scalable onboarding experience that accelerates time to productivity
  • Global hiring infrastructure built with embedded compliance and cultural alignment
  • Compensation structures that support internal equity and external competitiveness
  • Trusted partner to executives, with clear, proactive communication and follow-through

  • Proven experience managing and developing a team of recruiters, with a track record of building collaborative, high-performing talent teams
  • Deep expertise in full-cycle talent acquisition, including sourcing, structured interviewing, and candidate closing
  • Experience designing and executing global hiring strategies and navigating international labor laws
  • Strong understanding of compensation philosophy, benchmarking, and total rewards
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build trust across teams and senior leadership
  • Operational mindset with a bias for action, attention to detail, and systems thinking

We are seeking a Principal Developer Experience Engineer with a strong focus on AI enablement to make our engineers more effective, productive, and satisfied. This is a hands-on role: you will build, integrate, and maintain the tools and workflows that developers rely on every day. You‚Äôll also be a thought partner, bringing new ideas for how we can apply AI responsibly and effectively in our software development lifecycle.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about developer productivity, pragmatic about tooling choices, and proactive in shaping a culture of continuous improvement. While a heavy emphasis will be on AI-centric developer tooling and training, this role will also encompass broader developer experience initiatives across the software lifecycle.


Key Responsibilities

AI Enablement

  • Champion the effective use of AI in the software development lifecycle. Define, document, and evangelize best practices for the use of AI-powered tools, and continuously evaluate and identify new opportunities as the AI landscape evolves
  • Work closely with security, legal, and compliance stakeholders to ensure that all tools are safe, appropriate, and deployed responsibly
  • Provide hands-on training and workshops, develop content for our on-demand learning management system, curate or recommend external training programs, and pair directly with developers to teach AI development skills

Developer Experience & Productivity

  • Implement and manage a strong technical onboarding program for developers, ensuring new hires ramp up quickly and effectively
  • Partner closely with leaders in technical program management and product operations to refine and improve the software development lifecycle for effective delivery
  • Ensure developer toolchains (such as IDEs, review, and testing tools) are reliable, efficient, and well-supported
  • Collaborate with engineering leadership to define and measure productivity and satisfaction metrics, continuously identifying bottlenecks and opportunities

Code Quality

  • Own or administer quality management tools such as linters, static analysis tools, and test coverage measurement and reporting
  • Document code standards and integrate them into tools as applicable (for example, as context for AI agents and review bots)
  • Partner with engineering teams to strengthen code review practices, testing strategies, and continuous integration
  • Balance developer autonomy with quality management tooling, ensuring that processes enable, rather than hinder, the delivery of value

Culture & Advocacy

  • Serve as an advocate for developer needs across the organization
  • Foster a culture of experimentation, learning, and collaboration
  • Share knowledge widely: create documentation, run workshops, and mentor teams in best practices
     
  • 7+ years of hands-on software development experience, ideally spanning multiple languages and environments. Our current stack includes Ruby and Go codebases, and direct experience with at least one of these (preferably both) is required. Experience with Python for AI integrations is a significant plus.
  • Experience with Cursor is required; it is our primary IDE today
  • Demonstrated track record of success implementing AI-driven engineering practices showing measurable benefits
  • Excellent communication skills; ability to build consensus and influence across teams, considering multiple perspectives and developing solutions that balance them effectively
  • Commitment to data-driven decision making ‚Äî able to develop and test hypotheses effectively, continually adjusting strategy as a result of new information
  • Strong product mindset ‚Äî able to balance immediate developer pain points with long-term strategic improvements
  • Experience leading transformational projects and managing change well, ideally in sensitive, high-complexity environments with significant compliance or regulatory obligations
  • CS background preferred; experience in teaching/training is a significant plus

We are seeking a high-performing, results-oriented Sales Manager with deep expertise in the tolling industry to lead and grow our tolling sales vertical. This player-coach role will manage a team of account executives while also maintaining individual sales responsibilities and meeting quota. The ideal candidate is a tolling subject matter expert with experience in managing teams, selling enterprise software or SaaS solutions into tolling agencies or related government authorities.

This role is best suited for a self-starter who understands the unique dynamics of the tolling ecosystem, can lead with credibility, and deliver results while mentoring and building a high-performing team.

Responsibilities:

Drive Tolling-Specific Revenue Growth

  • Lead sales within the tolling space; build strategic relationships with public sector clients, tolling authorities, concessionaires, back office providers, and associated organizations.
  • Consistently meet or exceed revenue goals; this is a quota-carrying role.

Team Management and Leadership

  • Manage, coach, and develop a team of account executives; establish clear performance metrics and provide ongoing feedback.
  • Set team strategy and ensure execution through pipeline management, deal strategy sessions, and cross-functional collaboration.

Sales Execution

  • Own the entire sales cycle from prospecting to close for major tolling accounts.
  • Leverage industry relationships, RFP/RFI processes, and public procurement channels to drive business.

Strategic Market Development

  • Identify and develop new tolling market opportunities through research, networking, and outbound engagement.
  • Collaborate with product, marketing, and customer success to align messaging and influence product direction based on tolling-specific needs.

Cross-functional Leadership

Metrics & Measurement

CALIFORNIA CONSUMER PRIVACY ACT: APPLICANT NOTICE

Effective Date: January 1, 2020

Last Reviewed on: December 23, 2019

PayNearMe, Inc. (the ‚ÄúCompany‚Äù) is providing you with this Notice (‚ÄúNotice‚Äù) to inform you about:

  1. the categories of Personal Information that the Company collects and maintains about applicants; and
  2. the purposes for which the Company uses that Personal Information.

For purposes of this Notice, ‚ÄúPersonal Information‚Äù means information that identifies, relates to, describes, is capable of being associated with, or could reasonably be linked, directly or indirectly with, a natural person that the Company may collect in connection with screening applicants for job openings at the Company.

  1. Identifiers and Professional or Employment-Related Information. The Company collects identifiers and professional or employment-related information, which may include some or all the following: real name, nickname or alias, postal address, telephone number, e-mail address, membership in professional organizations, professional certifications, language skills, and current and past employment history. The Company collects this Personal Information to evaluate previous job performance and consider applicants for positions, to develop a talent pool and plan for succession, to conduct applicant surveys, to maintain an internal applicant directory and for purposes of identification, to promote the Company as a place to work, and for workforce reporting and data analytics/trend analysis.
  2. Personal Information Categories from Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß 1798.80(e). The Company may collect categories of Personal Information listed in Cal. Civ. Code ¬ß1798.80(e), other than those already listed above, (a) to the extent necessary to comply with the Company‚Äôs legal obligations, such as to accommodate disabilities; (b) to conduct a direct threat analysis in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act and state law; (c) for occupational health and safety compliance and record-keeping; and (d) to respond to an applicant‚Äôs medical emergency.
  3. Characteristics of Protected Classifications Under California or Federal Law. The Company may collect information about race, age, national origin, disability, sex, and veteran status as necessary to comply with legal obligations, including the reporting requirements of the federal Equal Employment Opportunity Act, the federal Office of Contracting Compliance Programs (applicable to government contractors), and California‚Äôs Fair Employment and Housing Act. The Company collects this Personal Information for purposes including: to comply with Federal and California law related to accommodation. The Company also collects this category of Personal Information on a purely voluntary basis, except where required by law, and uses the information only in compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
  4. Education Information. The Company collects education information such as resumes and graduation records. The Company collects this Personal Information to determine suitability for roles, to determine eligibility for training courses, and to assist with professional licensing.
  5. Profile Data. The Company may collect profile data, including the following: psychological assessments, behavior analyses, or other profiling of its applicants. The Company collects this Personal Information to determine aptitude for certain positions and job assignments as well.
  6. Background Screening Information. In the event that an applicant is given a formal job offer, the Company collects background screening information prior to hiring, including results of the following types of background screening: criminal history; sex offender registration; motor vehicle records; credit history; employment history; drug testing; and educational history. The Company collects this Personal Information to screen for risks to the Company and its clients, and continued suitability for their jobs and to evaluate applicants for promotions.

Assistance for Disabled Applicants

Alternative formats of this Notice are available to individuals with a disability. Please let us know if you need assistance.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

description:

The Client Services Manager will serve as the technical subject matter expert for PayNearMe‚Äôs solutions, supporting Sales, Account Management, and Merchant Support in the onboarding of merchants. This role involves leading technical integrations, configuring solutions, and providing ongoing technical support to ensure merchant success.

description:
At PayNearMe, we‚Äôre on a mission to make paying and getting paid as simple as possible. We build innovative technology that transforms the way businesses and their customers experience payments. We're looking for an experienced, technical Staff-level Technical Program Manager (TPM) to lead our Quality and Reliability efforts across critical systems and services. This is a high-impact, individual contributor role for someone who has done this before, who can build structure where needed, navigate ambiguity, and drive outcomes across multiple teams and domains.

You‚Äôll be responsible for leading cross-functional programs to improve system reliability, scalability, and operational quality, from improving incident response and production readiness to redefining the ways we test and deploy software. This is not a generalist role: we‚Äôre looking for a TPM with deep technical fluency and a track record of shaping system-level quality and delivery culture at scale.

What You‚Äôll Do

  • Own the Quality & Reliability Program: Define and drive the vision for quality‚Äîacross proactive practices (testing, deployment, observability), reactive processes (incident response, external communications), and cultural expectations (quality ownership, readiness).
  • Lead Cross-Functional Programs: Drive reliability and quality initiatives across Engineering, Product, Operations, and Customer Success.
  • Production Readiness: Own the Production Readiness Review (PRR) process; ensure all releases meet reliability standards before they go live.
  • Define and Drive SLOs: Establish and track Service Level Objectives (SLOs). Build visibility into reliability metrics and lead efforts to meet or exceed targets.
  • Improve Incident Management: Streamline incident response and postmortems. Drive structural improvements in tooling, communication, and ownership.
  • Scale Tooling & Automation: Collaborate across teams to enhance observability, alerting, testing automation, and response tooling.
  • Mitigate System Risk: Identify risk vectors early, build mitigation plans, and drive resolution with urgency.
  • Drive Alignment: Influence across Eng, Product, Ops, and GTM teams to prioritize reliability and integrate quality into every initiative.
  • Track Progress: Use tools like Atlas, Jira, and internal dashboards to maintain clarity on goals, risks, and outcomes.
  • Embed Continuous Learning: Build programs that ensure we learn from every incident, test edge cases, and continuously harden our systems.
  • 8+ years of program management experience, with at least 3 years in technical, reliability, or quality-focused domains.
  • Strong understanding of system architecture, distributed systems, and reliability engineering principles.
  • Familiarity with SDLC models, CI/CD pipelines, deployment automation, observability, and incident management tooling.
  • Demonstrated success defining and improving SLOs, SLIs, and production readiness processes.
  • Proven ability to lead large-scale, cross-functional programs across Engineering, Product, Operations, and Customer Success.
  • Skilled at translating complex technical goals into clear, actionable, and measurable outcomes.
  • Experienced in using Atlassian tools (e.g., Jira, Atlas) for program tracking, reporting, and executive communication.
  • Adept at navigating ambiguity, building alignment, and driving decision-making without formal authority.
  • Comfortable balancing technical depth with business priorities to influence outcomes.
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Bonus: Experience in regulated or high-availability industries such as fintech, healthcare, or infrastructure.

Benefits

  • Base salary per year (paid semi-monthly)
  • Fast- paced and professional work culture
  • Stock options with standard startup vesting - 1 year cliff; 4 years total
  • $50 monthly communication expense stipend to go towards your phone/internet bill
  • $250 stipend to enhance your WFH setup
  • Reimbursement for peripheral equipment: monitor (up to $400), keyboard and mouse (up to $200)
  • Premium medical benefits including vision and dental (100% coverage for employees)
  • Company-sponsored life and disability insurance
  • Paid parental bonding leave
  • Paid sick leave, jury duty, bereavement
  • 401k plan
  • Flexible Time Off (our team members typically take off ~3-4 weeks per year)
  • Volunteer Time Off
  • 13 scheduled holidays
  • 2x / year in-person team meet-ups

title: Senior Product Manager - Remote
description:
At PayNearMe, we‚Äôre on a mission to make paying and getting paid as simple as possible. We build innovative technology that transforms the way businesses and their customers experience payments. Our industry-leading platform, PayXM‚Ñ¢, is the first of its kind‚Äîdesigned to manage the entire payment experience from start to finish. Our single platform handles it all: cards, ACH, digital wallets such as PayPal, Venmo, Cash App Pay, Apple Pay and Google Pay, and even cash at more than 62,000 retail locations nationwide. Today, thousands of businesses across consumer lending, iGaming and online sports betting, property management, and tolling trust PayNearMe to deliver a payment experience that drives real results.

In September 2025, we raised a $50 million Series E funding round to accelerate our growth. 

We‚Äôre a team of 200+ employees across 41 states, headquartered in Silicon Valley with satellite offices in Dallas, TX and Holmdel, NJ.

Join us and be part of a team that‚Äôs shaping the future of payments‚Äîone experience at a time.

We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Product Manager to lead the strategy and execution of our next-generation money movement platform. You‚Äôll own the systems that power how money flows through our ecosystem ‚Äî with a focus on settlement, reconciliation, funding orchestration, and general ledger integrations.

In this role, you‚Äôll be at the center of our financial infrastructure, working across product, engineering, compliance, and accounting teams to build scalable, reliable payment systems. You‚Äôll drive execution across multiple payment rails and funding sources, ensuring operational accuracy, compliance, and performance at scale.

We‚Äôre seeking someone with deep experience in the payments ecosystem, particularly in bill pay, money movement, financial reconciliation, and funding mechanics. You should have a strong understanding of how different funding types operate ‚Äî including bank debits (ACH, RTP, wires), card-based funding, digital wallets, and alternative funding methods. You‚Äôll bring expertise in managing liquidity, funding source verification, cutoff windows, transaction routing, and exception handling. Familiarity with concepts like prefunding, sweep accounts, and funds availability will be key to ensuring efficient and resilient money flows.

You should be equally comfortable diving into backend systems, managing cross-functional roadmaps, and defining strategic product direction. This is a high-impact role where you‚Äôll help shape the future of how we move, fund, and track money ‚Äî and unlock new capabilities for the business as we scale.

Key Responsibilities

  • Own the end-to-end strategy for the money movement general ledgering systems ‚Äî ensuring funds flow accurately and are accounted for across internal platforms, with support for a variety of funding and disbursement methods.
  • Define and prioritize product requirements across key areas like settlement timing, transaction visibility, reconciliation tooling, error handling and disbursement processing
  • Demonstrate a strong understanding of the ACH ecosystem, including file formatting (NACHA), processing windows, risk and return codes, timing cutoffs and workflows
  • Lead product capabilities that support diverse funding methods, including ACH debits and credits, card-based transactions, digital wallets, and real-time disbursement networks
  • Communicate the product development roadmap across agile teams and stakeholders, while defining and documenting user stories that clearly guide technical requirements and implementation across both existing systems and new platform initiatives
  • Own the organization of the backlog, working proactively and collaboratively with Engineering management to ensure proper prioritization and capacity planning
  • Lead backlog grooming, refinement, and sprint planning sessions to ensure teams are set up for successful delivery
  • Act as a subject matter expert in funding mechanics and payment infrastructure, bridging business needs with technical implementation by collaborating with internal product teams, engineering, operations, accounting, and compliance partners
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams to develop products that meet both business goals and customer needs, with a keen focus on how money moves through internal and external networks ‚Äî including origination, processing, settlement, and disbursement.
  • Conduct market research and monitor evolving industry trends, regulations, and innovations across payment networks and funding technologies to inform strategic product decisions.
  • Collaborate with go-to-market teams to support product launches, documentation, and internal training, ensuring effective rollout of new funding-related features.
  • 8+ years of product management experience, with a strong focus on money movement, reconciliation, and settlement
  • An understanding of accounting principles and experience working directly with accounting teams
  • Payments industry knowledge, including experience with ACH, wire transfers, card settlements, and reconciliation processes
  • Strong technical, analytical, and problem-solving skills, with demonstrated ability to leverage data in making informed product decisions
  • Exceptional communication and leadership capabilities, with experience guiding development teams and managing cross-functional stakeholder relationships
  • Must be detail-oriented, with a commitment to delivering high-quality product documentation
  • Intrinsic curiosity to dive into complex problems and review solutions 
  • Working knowledge of JIRA and Confluence
  • Familiarity with accounting processes and financial events

Benefits

  • Base salary per year (paid semi-monthly)
  • Fast- paced and professional work culture
  • Stock options with standard startup vesting - 1 year cliff; 4 years total
  • $50 monthly communication expense stipend to go towards your phone/internet bill
  • $250 stipend to enhance your WFH setup
  • Reimbursement for peripheral equipment: monitor (up to $400), keyboard and mouse (up to $200)
  • Premium medical benefits including vision and dental (100% coverage for employees)
  • Company-sponsored life and disability insurance
  • Paid parental bonding leave
  • Paid sick leave, jury duty, bereavement
  • 401k plan
  • Flexible Time Off (our team members typically take off ~3-4 weeks per year)
  • Volunteer Time Off
  • 13 scheduled holidays

Salary Range: $150,000 - 185,000

description:

Join us and be part of a team that‚Äôs shaping the future of payments‚Äîone experience at a time.

As our Site Reliability Engineer, you will design, build, and maintain the systems and infrastructure that power our applications, ensuring their reliability, scalability, and performance. You will bring a software engineering approach to operations, automating processes, and continuously improving the infrastructure and tools to support our business needs.


What you‚Äôll do: 

  • Infrastructure Management: Design, implement, and maintain scalable and resilient infrastructure using Terraform for infrastructure as code, ensuring high availability and performance.
  • Kubernetes and Containers: Deploy, manage, and optimize Kubernetes clusters and containerized applications using Docker. Implement best practices for container orchestration and management.
  • Systems and Application Monitoring/Observability: Develop and maintain comprehensive monitoring and observability solutions using Datadog. Ensure detailed visibility into system performance and application health.
  • SLOs and SLA Management: Define, monitor, and maintain Service Level Objectives (SLOs) and Service Level Agreements (SLAs) to ensure reliable and consistent service delivery.
  • Incident Response and Troubleshooting: Respond to incidents, perform root cause analysis, and implement solutions to prevent recurrence. Participate in post-incident reviews and contribute to blameless postmortems.
  • Reliability and Production Environment Management: Ensure the reliability and stability of our production environments. Continuously assess and improve system reliability, identifying and addressing potential points of failure.
  • Automation and Scripting: Develop automation scripts and tools to reduce manual intervention and improve system reliability using Python, Bash, or Go. Implement and improve CI/CD pipelines.
  • CI/CD Pipeline Management: Enhance and maintain continuous integration and continuous deployment pipelines using GitLab CI. Ensure seamless and reliable deployment processes.
  • Capacity Planning and Scaling: Assist in capacity planning and ensure that systems are scalable to meet future demands. Implement auto-scaling strategies where applicable.
  • Security and Compliance: Implement security best practices and ensure compliance with industry standards. Regularly review and update security policies and procedures.
  • Collaboration and Support: Work closely with development teams to ensure reliability and scalability of new features and services. Provide technical support and guidance on infrastructure-related issues.
  • Software Engineering for Operations: Develop and maintain internal tools and services that enhance the efficiency and reliability of our operations.
  • On-Call Rotation: Participate in an on-call rotation to address production issues and collaborate in incident response efforts.
  • Experience: +3 years of experience in SRE, DevOps, or a related role.
  • Cloud Platform Experience: Proficient with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure. Experience with EC2, RDS, VPCs, and security groups is essential.
  • Kubernetes and Containers: Strong experience with Kubernetes and Docker, including deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.
  • Infrastructure as Code: Expert in using Terraform for infrastructure as code. Proficient with configuration management tools such as Ansible, Puppet, or Chef.
  • Monitoring and Observability: Extensive experience with monitoring and observability tools like Datadog, Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack, or Splunk. Skilled in setting up detailed monitoring and logging systems.
  • SLOs and SLA Management: Proven ability to define, monitor, and maintain SLOs and SLAs to ensure reliable service delivery.
  • Scripting and Automation: Strong skills in scripting languages like Python, Bash, or Go. Experience automating repetitive tasks and processes.
  • CI/CD Practices: Familiarity with GitLab CI or similar tool for continuous integration and deployment. Experience in setting up and managing pipelines.
  • Production Environments: Experience supporting production environments running Go or Ruby/Rails applications.
  • Tool Development: Ability to write and update tools to support infrastructure and application management, demonstrating the principle that ‚ÄúSRE is what happens when you ask a software engineer to design an operations team.‚Äù
  • DevOps Best Practices: Deep understanding of DevOps principles, practices, and tools to drive continuous improvement in the software development lifecycle.
  • Soft Skills: Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. Excellent documentation skills to ensure accurate and detailed records.
  • Problem-Solving Ability: Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills to diagnose and resolve complex system issues quickly and effectively.

  • Fast- paced and professional work culture
  • Stock options with standard startup vesting - 1 year cliff; 4 years total
  • $50 monthly communication expense stipend to go towards your phone/internet bill

title: Statistical Analyst/ Graphics Developer (Remote)
description:
About Us

Powered by one of the largest global newsrooms in sports media, The Athletic brings sports fans the most comprehensive stories about the teams, sports and athletes they love. The Athletic‚Äôs newsroom of 500+ full-time staff delivers in-depth coverage of hundreds of professional and college teams across more than 47 North American markets and all 20 football clubs in the English Premier League, as well as many Championship clubs.

About the Role

The Athletic is looking for a journalist with experience in data visualization, statistics and engineering to help advance its mission of being the world‚Äôs best destination for sports fans. This is a wide-ranging, generalist role on the Athletic‚Äôs Visuals and Data team, with opportunities to help shape projects of all kinds, whether it‚Äôs a modest chart, an analytical conclusion, an expansive standalone visualization or a live application. 

This is 100% remote for candidates based in the United States or Canada.

Responsibilities

  • Use data and analysis to communicate our reporting stronger and more clearly.
  • Publish clear, compelling and imaginative data visualizations.
  • Help imagine and build interactive projects and applications.
  • Consult and advise on our use of statistics and editorial conclusions from data.

    • Requirements

  • Experience working with data and statistics and an understanding of the communication of causality, uncertainty and statistical forecasting.
  • Experience conceiving, prototyping and deploying interactive projects of all sizes, from engineering foundations to frontend details.
  • A creative approach to the news and sports, with an eye for finding novel angles and data sets in odd places.
  • A track record of close collaboration with other journalists and technologists.
  • Demonstrated excellence in publishing data visualizations for mass audiences.
  • Experience working within design tools like Figma or Adobe Creative Suite.
  • This is a remote-based role with candidates willing to work regularly from our New York City office preferred.

    • The Athletic offers unique perks and benefits to all full-time employees based on their country of residence. Our comprehensive US benefits package includes:

    - Highly competitive, employer-contributed medical, dental, vision, basic life and disability insurance plans.
    - Savings accounts for medical, wellness, and childcare expenses.

title: Graphics Developer, Platforms and Publishing Tools (Remote)
description:
About Us

Powered by one of the largest global newsrooms in sports media, The Athletic brings sports fans the most comprehensive stories about the teams, sports and athletes they love. The Athletic‚Äôs newsroom of 500+ full-time staff delivers in-depth coverage of hundreds of professional and college teams across more than 47 North American markets and all 20 football clubs in the English Premier League, as well as many Championship clubs.

About the Role

The Athletic is looking for a journalist with a strong engineering foundation to help us manage and build out a publishing pipeline for interactive journalism. You will work as part of the newsroom's Data and Visuals team, in close collaboration with colleagues on the Engineering and Product teams, as well as with reporters and editors from around the company. In this job, you will make sure our technical foundations, publishing pipeline and integration across our apps, home screen and other platforms are seamless and performant. You will help maintain and improve our technical infrastructure, ensuring it remains flexible and performant for a wide range of products.

This is 100% remote for candidates based in the United States or Canada. Ability to work in a hybrid schedule out of the New York City office is highly preferred. 

Responsibilities

  • Help build and maintain our technical platforms and publishing pipeline for interactive and visual journalism, on projects like The Beast and our NFL forecast.
  • Work with journalists and engineers to make sure our work fits into our broader products.
  • Develop and improve our tooling as it relates to interactive journalism, as a resource for technical journalists around the company.

    • Requirements

  • Experience envisioning and maintaining publishing platforms.
  • A journalistic sensibility and flexibility in your approach to technology, as projects and priorities often change quickly.
  • Experience working and collaborating with a wide range of colleagues.

    • The annual base salary range for this role is $150,000.00 - $190,000.00 USD. The total compensation offered for this position may vary based on factors such as education, experience, skills, and location. It may also include non-cash rewards and benefits. The base salary range is subject to change and may be modified in the future.

    - 401k retirement savings plan and employer match.

title: Graphics Data Reporter (Remote)
description:
About Us

Powered by one of the largest global newsrooms in sports media, The Athletic brings sports fans the most comprehensive stories about the teams, sports and athletes they love. The Athletic‚Äôs newsroom of 500+ full-time staff delivers in-depth coverage of hundreds of professional and college teams across more than 47 North American markets and all 20 football clubs in the English Premier League, as well as many Championship clubs.

About the Role

The Athletic is looking for a versatile reporter to join its Data and Visuals team. This is a generalist position in which your work could vary by the day or week. Some days you may be publishing articles and charts about analytics, sports strategy, trade values, the salary cap or sports analytics. Others you may need to find or analyze data in partnership with another reporter or editor. You may develop and publish charts, tables or other visual explanations, alongside more straightforward writing and reporting. And you may pitch in on tasks of all kinds on large interactive projects, from The Beast to our NFL Playoff tools ‚Äî and applications we have yet to imagine or create.

This is 100% remote for candidates based in the United States or Canada. Ability to work in a hybrid schedule out of the New York City office is highly preferred. 

Responsibilities

  • Conceiving of creative and distinct story ideas.
  • Collaborating with other members of the Visuals desk and colleagues from around The Athletic.
  • Producing work in a range of forms, from written stories to charts to other visual forms.
  • Data analysis in a variety of forms.
  • A range of interactive development, from light chart production to developing interactive applications.

title: Senior / Staff Product Manager, Applications (Collaborator)
description:
About Onebrief

Onebrief is collaboration and AI-powered workflow software designed specifically for military staffs. By transforming this work, Onebrief makes the staff as a whole superhuman - meaning faster, smarter, and more efficient.

We take ownership, seek excellence, and play to win with the seriousness and camaraderie of an Olympic team. Onebrief operates as an all-remote company, though many of our employees work alongside our customers at military commands around the world.

Founded in 2019 by a group of experienced planners, today, Onebrief‚Äôs team spans veterans from all forces and global organizations, and technologists from leading-edge software companies. We‚Äôve raised $123m+ from top-tier investors, including Battery Ventures, General Catalyst, Insight Partners, and Human Capital, and today, Onebrief is valued at $1.1B. With this continued growth, Onebrief is able to make an impact where it matters most.

About the Role

As a tenured Product Manager (Senior to Staff), you will define and execute Onebrief‚Äôs vision for its core planning and collaboration applications. These applications are the foundation of how staffs design and synchronize operations, surface risks, validate feasibility, and deliver executable plans.

Your mission is to ensure these core applications are powerful, intuitive, and indispensable for operational planning. You will partner closely with Engineering, Design, and military SMEs to refine and expand workflows, build new capabilities, and strengthen the reliability and usability that allow staffs to work at speed and scale.

Responsibilities

Product Strategy: Own the product strategy for Onebrief‚Äôs core applications, ensuring they meet the demands of real-world operational planning.

User-Centered Design: Translate user feedback and doctrine into clear workflows and features that deliver meaningful value to users while driving adoption and retention.

Execution Excellence: Partner with Engineering and Design to deliver high-quality, reliable experiences that reduce rework and increase staff confidence in the platform.

Workflow Innovation: Define and prioritize enhancements that improve coordination, accelerate feasibility validation, and support faster decision-making under time pressure.

Impact Measurement: Measure product impact in terms of feasibility validation, risk surfacing, planning speed, and mission outcomes.

Vision and Communication: Communicate vision and progress clearly across a distributed, async-first team and with external stakeholders.

About You

You thrive in complex environments and enjoy turning fragmented processes into seamless, intuitive workflows. You balance deep user empathy with technical understanding, and you know how to prioritize features that have the greatest impact on adoption and mission success. You are excited to shape the foundational workflows that define how staffs plan operations.

Qualifications

  • 3-5+ years of product management experience, with a preferred at least 3 years in B2B SaaS, data-rich platforms, or workflow software.

  • Proven track record building complex workflows or domain-specific modules with measurable user impact.

  • Experience working with structured data, visualization, or collaboration systems.

  • Strong understanding of operational planning, sustainment, or intelligence workflows, ideally in defense or high-trust domains.

  • Excellent communication skills, especially in async and distributed environments.

  • Ability to obtain and hold a U.S. security clearance.

  • Bonus: Experience in defense, operational planning, or military staff membership or workflows.

Why Join Onebrief?

The workflows you help deliver will shape how military organizations design and execute missions. By strengthening the core of the platform, you will empower staffs to plan faster, safer, and with greater confidence in feasibility. Join a high-performing team building breakthrough tools for those who need them most.

title: Project Manager (Operations)
description:
We‚Äôre Jiffy. We launched over a decade ago with a simple mission: use tech to combine an unparalleled level of customer service with the fastest delivery in the blank apparel, direct-to-film transfer, and custom apparel industries.We‚Äôre more than a T-Shirt company; we‚Äôre a support system for the creator + creator economy, home hobbyist, the small business owner, and more. Today, we help millions of small businesses build their vision from scratch.

We are seeking an Operations Project Manager to drive execution across the Operations team and ensure alignment between strategic objectives, initiatives, and day-to-day tasks. This individual will manage deliverable schedules, drive clarity around priorities, and facilitate seamless cross-functional coordination, ensuring projects stay on track and deliver meaningful outcomes. The Operations Project Manager will serve as the connective tissue across Business, Operations, and Technology teams, synthesizing updates for executives, identifying risks, escalating issues when needed, and unblocking the team to maintain momentum. This role requires an analytical, and highly versatile generalist who can manage multiple initiatives in parallel, structure complex work into actionable tasks, and step in to support specific workstreams when needed.

Key Responsibilities

  • Oversee and manage due dates and timelines, business sprint plans, Gantt chart visualizations, and dependency mapping by working backwards from desired outcomes and deliverables.
  • Connect strategic objectives to initiatives, tasks, and timelines, ensuring alignment across teams and stakeholders.
  • Prioritize projects and tasks based on business impact, resources, and dependencies. Consistently set expectations and develop weekly plans of attack against plan.
  • Drive meeting management: set clear agendas, ensure preparation, and facilitate productive, on-time discussions.
  • Track progress, identify risks to projects, timelines, and resources, and escalate issues as needed to drive resolution and keep initiatives on schedule.  
  • Build paper trails on decisions, context, and expectations around deliverables. Develop documentation to establish knowledge continuity.
  • Synthesize updates and prepare concise executive-level communications.
  • Get hands-on and assist teammates to get projects across the finish line. Step in to support specific tasks or projects where complexity or capacity constraints require additional hands-on contribution.
  • Lead special projects as assigned, often involving ambiguous problem spaces requiring analytical structure and execution.

Requirements

Basic Qualifications

  • Bachelors Degree required
  • 5+ years of project or program management experience, ideally in operations, supply chain, or a cross-functional business environment.
  • Proven ability to manage large, complex initiatives with multiple stakeholders and dependencies.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; able to bring clarity to ambiguous challenges.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to tailor updates for executives and stakeholders at all levels.
  • Proficiency in project management tools (e.g., JIRA, Asana, Smartsheet, or equivalent).
  • Demonstrated ability to build project schedules and Gantt charts, manage timelines, and work backwards from outcomes.
  • High EQ and inherent understanding of how to keep teams motivated and on track through ambiguous situations and expectations.
  • Strong facilitation and meeting management skills.
  • Highly organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to juggle multiple projects in parallel.
  • Understanding of supply chain, manufacturing, and fulfillment concepts.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience in eCommerce, operations, or supply chain environments.
  • Exposure to both business and technology teams, with the ability to ‚Äútranslate‚Äù between technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • PMP or equivalent project management certification

Location: Remote in PST or Hybrid in Irvine CA (may require travel as needed)

Why You Will Love Working At Jiffy

  • Opportunity to grow our market share through innovation in the rapidly evolving fashion, AI and image processing space.
  • Collaborative and high growth environment, with direct impact on the company's strategic direction.
  • High visibility and influence in marketing cutting edge e-commerce solutions.

Benefits

What We Offer

  • Compensation & Growth: Competitive salary, equity opportunities, and performance-based bonuses.
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Full medical, dental, and vision coverage, with a portion of premiums paid by Jiffy.
  • Retirement Planning: 401(k)
  • Wellness Support: Annual wellness benefits to help you stay healthy and balanced.
  • Tools for Success: Choice of MacBook or PC laptop, plus equipment for your home office setup.
  • Perks & Extras: Annual credit of $200 to use on our website plus more team merch drops than you will know what to do with!
  • Professional Development: Annual stipend to support your learning and career growth.

EEO

Jiffy is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Jiffy considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Jiffy is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures.

title: Community Manager (Miami)
description:
We‚Äôre Jiffy. We launched over a decade ago with a simple mission: use tech to combine an unparalleled level of customer service with the fastest delivery in the blank apparel, direct-to-film transfer, and custom apparel industries.We‚Äôre more than a T-Shirt company; we‚Äôre a support system for the creator + creator economy, home hobbyist, the small business owner, and more. Today, we help millions of small businesses build their vision from scratch.

Jiffy Shirts is on a mission to fundamentally disrupt the stagnant, multi-billion-dollar custom apparel industry. We are an AI-first technology company building the future of on-demand manufacturing and e-commerce. We have a profitable, fast-growing business, and we are reinvesting to build a future where fashion is instant, personal, and created by everyone.

We operate with a wartime mentality. Our culture is defined by speed, extreme ownership, and a relentless refusal to be blocked. We are not looking for someone who wants a comfortable 9-to-5. We are looking for operators who want to get in the fight, aggressively take on the market, and build something legendary.

Requirements

Basic Qualifications

  • You currently reside in Miami and possess intimate, first-hand knowledge of its distinct neighborhoods, cultural hubs, economic arteries, and university ecosystems. You know South Beach, the vibe of Wynwood, the pulse of the University of Miami, and the key players in the local business scene. This is a non-negotiable.
  • You have a proven track record (5+ years) of launching and scaling local, field, or community marketing campaigns from the ground up, with specific demonstrable success in an urban market.
  • You are a real-world embodiment of a Jiffy Operator:
  • Extreme Ownership: You see MIA‚Äôs market share, P&L, and team performance as a direct reflection of your leadership. There are no excuses.
  • Extreme Bias for Action: You are a doer, not a delegator. You are uncomfortable with meetings that don't end in immediate next steps.
  • Relentless Tenacity: You have a history of running through walls to achieve a goal. Problems are opportunities, not blockers.
  • You are a Data Zealot. You have deep experience managing a budget, setting and tracking KPIs for multi-channel campaigns (both online and offline), and holding yourself and your team accountable to ROI, CAC, and LTV.
  • You are a proven leader and recruiter. You have experience hiring, training, and managing a distributed team of high-performing field operators or community managers.
  • You have direct, hands-on experience with scrappy, guerrilla marketing tactics. You've run campus activations, launched dorm blitzes, negotiated local partnerships, and executed event hijacks yourself.
  • You are proficient with hyper-local digital channels, including geo-targeted social media campaigns (Meta), Google My Business/Yelp optimization, and local SEM.
  • You have experience thriving in a high-growth, ambiguous, and resource-constrained startup environment. You know how to make a dollar do the work of ten.
  • You have strong negotiation skills for securing partnerships with everyone from university clubs to local business owners.

Preferred Qualifications

  • You have an existing network within the Los Angeles small business, university, or creative communities.
  • You have experience in the apparel, e-commerce, creator economy, or CPG space.
  • You have a personal passion for AI, design, and leveraging new technology to solve old problems.

This Role Is Not A Fit For You If....

  • This role WON'T have a large, established team or unlimited resources. You must be a builder and a doer from day one.
  • This role WON'T have a slow, predictable 9-to-5 schedule. The mission requires operating with urgency at all times.
  • This role WON'T be a fit for someone who needs perfect data or a rigid process to make decisions. You must thrive in controlled chaos.
  • This role WON'T be for a pure strategist; you must be willing and eager to execute tactics on the ground yourself to lead your team by example.

Location: Remote in Miami FL area, (may require travel as needed) 

Why You Will Love Working At Jiffy

  • Opportunity to grow our marketing function through innovation in the rapidly evolving fashion, AI and image processing space.
  • Collaborative and high growth environment, with direct impact on the company's strategic direction.
  • High visibility and influence in marketing cutting edge e-commerce solutions.

Benefits

What We Offer

  • Compensation & Growth: Competitive salary, equity opportunities, and performance-based bonuses.
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Full medical, dental, and vision coverage, with a portion of premiums paid by Jiffy.
  • Retirement Planning: 401(k)
  • Wellness Support: Annual wellness benefits to help you stay healthy and balanced.
  • Tools for Success: Choice of MacBook or PC laptop, plus equipment for your home office setup.
  • Perks & Extras: Annual credit of $200 to use on our website plus more team merch drops than you will know what to do with!
  • Professional Development: Annual stipend to support your learning and career growth.

EEO

Jiffy is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Jiffy considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Jiffy is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures.
